summary: This document is a list of exhibits for Chapter 4 of a report, likely from the Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General. It catalogs 54 items related to the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's arrest, detention, and death at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. The exhibits include legal filings, Bureau of Prisons reports, psychological assessments, and interview memoranda.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure of the case, an inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center who was indicted and died while in custody. The exhibits document his legal case, psychological state, and the circumstances of his death.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: Another inmate mentioned in a superseding indictment and BOP memoranda, indicating he was housed in the same facility as Epstein.

persons.name: Reid Weingarten
persons.context: Filed a motion regarding pretrial release for Jeffrey Epstein on July 11, 2019.

persons.name: Richard M. Berman
persons.context: The U.S. District Court judge presiding over Jeffrey Epstein's criminal case, to whom several legal filings were addressed.

persons.name: Frederico Rancier-Medrano
persons.context: An inmate at BOP who was interviewed by the FBI on August 22, 2019, regarding the Epstein case.

persons.name: Efrain Reyes
persons.context: An inmate at BOP who was interviewed by the FBI on August 28, 2019, regarding the Epstein case.

connections.description: Weingarten filed a motion for pretrial release on behalf of Epstein, indicating he was part of Epstein's legal defense team.
Judge Berman presided over Epstein's criminal case and issued decisions, including an order remanding him.
Both were inmates at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, with BOP memoranda referencing them in the same context.

events.title: Epstein Indictment Filed
events.description: An indictment was filed against Jeffrey Epstein in the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Epstein Suicide Attempt in Custody
events.description: Multiple BOP memoranda document a suicide attempt or incident involving inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

events.title: Epstein's Death
events.description: A BOP After Action Review was conducted regarding the suicide of inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

events.title: Court Order Remanding Epstein
events.description: A Decision and Order was filed remanding defendant Jeffrey Epstein, denying pretrial release.

events.title: Motion for Pretrial Release Filed
events.description: Defense attorney Reid Weingarten filed a motion regarding pretrial release for Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York
Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: The document lists exhibits detailing the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on August 10, 2019.
Epinson had a documented suicide attempt or incident on July 23, 2019, while in custody, prior to his death.
The exhibits include psychological assessments, medical records, and BOP internal reviews of Epstein's detention and suicide prevention protocols.
Multiple FBI interviews were conducted with BOP staff and other inmates, including Frederico Rancier-Medrano and Efrain Reyes, as part of the investigation.
The legal proceedings against Epstein included an indictment (July 2, 2019), a motion for pretrial release (July 11, 2019), and a court order remanding him (July 18, 2019).
